content:
TITLE: OneSignal Initialization with State Management
DESCRIPTION: Example of initializing OneSignal and updating a React state variable upon completion. It also demonstrates prompting for push notifications after initialization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const [initialized, setInitialized] = useState(false);
OneSignal.init({ appId: 'xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx' }).then(() => {
  setInitialized(true);
  OneSignal.Slidedown.promptPush();
  // do other stuff
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing OneSignal in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Basic initialization of OneSignal with an app ID. The init function returns a promise that resolves when OneSignal is loaded.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
import OneSignal from 'react-onesignal';

OneSignal.init({ appId: 'xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx' });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Async Initialization of OneSignal
DESCRIPTION: Example of initializing OneSignal using async/await syntax, allowing for additional actions after initialization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
await OneSignal.init({ appId: 'xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx' });
// do other stuff
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Push Subscription Methods in React OneSignal
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to opt in a user for push notifications using the OneSignal User PushSubscription namespace. This allows subscribing the current user to receive push notifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
OneSignal.User.PushSubscription.optIn();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding OneSignal Event Listener
DESCRIPTION: Example of adding an event listener for notification clicks using the OneSignal API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
OneSignal.Notifications.addEventListener('click', (event) => {
  console.log('The notification was clicked!', event);
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the User Namespace in OneSignal v3
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to use the User namespace in OneSignal v3 to add an alias for the current user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
OneSignal.User.addAlias("my_alias", "1234");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the Slidedown Namespace in OneSignal v3
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to display a push notification permission prompt using the Slidedown namespace in OneSignal v3.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
await OneSignal.Slidedown.promptPush();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Requesting Notification Permission in OneSignal v3
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to request permission for notifications using the new Notifications namespace in OneSignal v3.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
await OneSignal.Notifications.requestPermission();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Migrating from setExternalId to login/logout in OneSignal
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to migrate from the deprecated setExternalId method to the new login and logout methods in OneSignal v3.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
OneSignal.setExternalId("myId");
```

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
OneSignal.login("myId");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OneSignal TypeScript Interface
DESCRIPTION: TypeScript interface definition for the OneSignal object, providing type information for various OneSignal methods and properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: TypeScript
CODE:
```
interface IOneSignalOneSignal {
  Slidedown: IOneSignalSlidedown;
  Notifications: IOneSignalNotifications;
  Session: IOneSignalSession;
  User: IOneSignalUser;
  Debug: IOneSignalDebug;
  login(externalId: string, jwtToken?: string): Promise<void>;
  logout(): Promise<void>;
  init(options: IInitObject): Promise<void>;
  setConsentGiven(consent: boolean): Promise<void>;
  setConsentRequired(requiresConsent: boolean): Promise<void>;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OneSignal V2 Initialization Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Example of initializing OneSignal using the version 2 API. This demonstrates the simplified initialization pattern that takes a configuration object with the application ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import OneSignal from 'react-onesignal';

OneSignal.init({ appId: 'xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx' });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Debug Log Level in React OneSignal
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting the log level for OneSignal debugging. This allows developers to control the verbosity of logs from trace (most detailed) to error (least detailed).
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
OneSignal.Debug.setLogLevel("trace");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Aliases in OneSignal
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how aliases are structured in OneSignal to identify users. Aliases consist of label-id pairs, where each user can have multiple aliases to identify them across different systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
// WebSDK-specific example
{
  external_id: "1234",
  my_alias: "5678"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing react-onesignal via npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the react-onesignal package using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npm install --save react-onesignal
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing react-onesignal via yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the react-onesignal package using yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
yarn add react-onesignal
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Service Worker Import for OneSignal v3
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for updating the service worker import script from the older version to version 16 of OneSignal SDK.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/MigrationGuide.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
importScripts("https://onesignal.com/sdks/OneSignalSDKWorker.js");
```

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
importScripts("https://onesignal.com/sdks/web/v16/OneSignalSDK.sw.js");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Version Comparison in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to format version comparisons in a Markdown changelog, including links to GitHub comparison views.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
## [3.2.2](https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/compare/3.2.1...3.2.2) (2025-03-28)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Formatting Changelog Entries in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to structure changelog entries with headers for different types of changes (e.g., Bug Fixes, Features) and individual commit references.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
### Bug Fixes

* add promise reject for init call ([daadfa8](https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/commit/daadfa8de3ba98a2b9bd81a497187c4ef07cbc30))
* add promise reject for init call ([f951175](https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/commit/f9511751b930cc65ec78e355f07056c54ac997be))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing GitHub Issues in Markdown Changelog
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to link to GitHub issues within a changelog entry using Markdown syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
* sync with web-shim-codegen v3.0.1 ([93627ba](https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/commit/93627ba19f6aac555b68ef726b7d6ae9c4aa2a31)), closes [#143](https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/issues/143)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Default Robot Access Rules
DESCRIPTION: Standard robots.txt directives that allow all web crawlers (User-agent: *) complete access to the site with no disallowed paths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/OneSignal/react-onesignal/blob/main/example/public/robots.txt#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```
